main.name: Kenneth Yeung
main.description: Currently I am working as a Cloud Architect for one of the biggest German car company.
main.bio:
Hello and welcome! 

 I created this page to not only showcase the projects I am working on but also to delve into the fascinating world of React development.

My professional journey has taken me from the structured world of Mechanical Engineering to the dynamic and ever-evolving landscapes of Software Development, Cloud, Platform Engineering, and CI/CD. 

Previously, I honed my skills in Java and JavaScript development at Accenture, and I am currently embracing the role of an AWS Architect at Volkswagen.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering
Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering

workTimeline.title: AWS Consultant
workTimeline.description: Kenneth has been working on many client projects for two German premium car manufacturers and a national government. He supported in the area of Java, Sprint Boot, JavaScript, Dojo, Jenkins for Continious Integration/Continious Deployment, AWS Service, Azure cloud and Terraform as Infrastructure as a Code.

workTimeline.title: Quality Engineer
workTimeline.description: As a Quality Engineer, Kenneth was responsible of the comfirmity and releases of the landing gear parts of the Airbus 320/321/XLR321 planes.

cloud.name: Terraform for AWS and for Azure

testimonials.text:
In my role as Agile Coach on a client project, I had the pleasure of working with Kenneth for some time.
 He came as an additional developer to an already existing team and integrated great into the team within a very short time.
